title: To Be Called A Father
summary:
For the VGen challenge, Egg!
Some not maingame TWEWY spoilers in the details about Father and some of his transition journey.
details:
When Father was alive as a human gave birth to Chisa and then some number of years later he died and joined the Reaper's Game. Perhaps a bit before but definitely during the Reaper's Game his trans egg began to crack. He survived the Game but was unable to bring himself to return to life, partially because he was conflicted about his gender identity and what it would mean to go back to life. To potentially lose that part of himself, or to regain it but maybe hide it if he wasn't accepted. Since he was unable to even say the words he wanted to be resurrected, the Composer took the decision away from him, and gave him the option to become a Reaper or be Erased.

He bitterly chose to become a Reaper, not wanting to give up, but his spirit was crushed, blaming both himself and the Composer for being unable to return to his family. He felt he was a failure, and the feeling only compounded after an Incident that resulted in Chisa's Soul being lost to the Void from his fingertips, which meant no one except the Reapers and the Composer even remembered her existence.

Time passed and by the time he Ascended to become an Angel he had almost fully transitioned and embraced himself as a man. Accepting the position as a "Father" gave him another chance and began to heal him. More time passed and his former Composer, Null, surprised him with a visit with a special guest - Father's own daughter, Chisa, rescued from the Void.

Null told Chisa nothing about him, believing it was best for Father to handle the situation. It absolutely scared him and took a bit of time for him to not overdo it to have Chisa accept him. It takes Chisa time to get used to her new father but she still loves him and is so happy to see him once again, as who he truly is.

Even is he likes cats a little too much.

imgs.alt: Digital art of a closeup of transgender man during mid transition looking up outside of a cracked transgender flag coloured egg at his feature self looking down at his daughter, Chisa, and they are both happy. His mid transitioned self has cut his natural brown coloured hair short and has his legs drawn up to hide his bound chest. He looks up anxiously with natural brown eyes at a potential future where he can see his daughter again, who accepts and loves him as a father. His future self has long hair once again, but blond, and pink eyes. His rainbow coloured hand is placed on top of Chisa's head as she smiles and holds an orange jellyfish plushie that he made for her, close against her chest.

Digital art of the full image of a transgender man during mid transition looking up outside of a cracked transgender flag coloured egg at his feature self looking down at his daughter, Chisa, and they are both happy. His mid transitioned self has cut his natural brown coloured hair short and has his legs drawn up to hide his bound chest. He looks up anxiously with natural brown eyes at a potential future where he can see his daughter again, who accepts and loves him as a father. His future self has long hair once again, but blond, and pink eyes. His rainbow coloured hand is placed on top of Chisa's head as she smiles and holds an orange jellyfish plushie that he made for her, close against her chest.

title: Father Stretch!
summary:
Drew my OC, Father, doing a cute stretching animation! It was made for stream that I can put up when I should be taking a stretch break.

Don't forgot to take breaks, get up, and stretch!!

imgs.alt: A gif of my OC, Father, standing up with his hands stretched up and locked together held straight over his head. He starts standing straight up, then tilts to his right, then back to center, then to his left, and then loops.
Digital art of Nao from The World Ends With you looking up-left.

title: Thank You Bouquet
summary:
Made for February's VGen Challenge of "Bouquet". I decided to spotlight one of my OCs this time, even though none of them are really associated with bouquets of flowers. Null is the closest, who I associate with trees/branches/roots, but sometimes Null's hair with the pink tips sometimes makes me think of pink petals - cherry blossoms maybe - and decided to give them a bouquet!

I don't know a lot about flower language and combining them but apparently this is a bouquet for giving thanks? If not, the colours I think go well together.

So, thank you, Null!

imgs.alt: Digital art of my original character, called Null, holding a bouquet of flowers containing white lilies, pink roses and Eustoma Russellianum. Their eyes are closed as the hold the bouquet close to their chest and face, enjoying the fragrance. Behind them are stylized bushes and a tree in shades of green.

title: Cheer Up, Sota!

title: Cat Comcatibility - Chisa
summary: Chisa gets a whole comic for her Cat Comcatibility Check! She unfortunately chose to try and make friends with a cat That Did Not Want Pets. So now begins her arc of declaring war on cats, not helped by her Father seemly siding with those feisty furballs over her!
details:
A stunning example of Father's parenting! Keeping it spoiler free for this post, but his current perspective and priority Chisa, life, cats, and so on causes some friction between the two.

While Null understands Father's perspective they have become incredibly protective of Chisa, and at times a little much like this cat interaction here. They didn't need to pull Chisa away so strongly and scare away the cat and they didn't need to try and confront Father about it so strongly.

Chisa knows a cat scratch wouldn’t have been awful, and she knew there was a possibility of it happening in the first place but she was hoped it would be ok somehow. Despite that, she was hoping her Father would have shown at least a hint of proper care towards her. Just a small, even lightly spoken, “You ok? It’ll heal over quickly, see?”

It's something she wants to hear.

imgs.alt:
Comic of a young girl named Chisa meets a cat. Part 1, Chisa sits next to an angry cat and says, "Kitty...! It's OK..." and the person behind her in green, called Null, thinks "Chisa!" and the man next to them, Father, is excited.

Part 2, Father smiles as he thinks of the cat's cute paw while Null protects Chisa from the cat swiping her. Null glare and the cat runs away with a "MREEOW".        

Part 3, Null angrily approaches Father and says "You-!" but is cut off by Father cheerfully saying "See, she's fine!" He thinks to himself, "Besides, that cat can't kill her." Chisa calls out, ""N-Null-ren! Father!"" and places herself between the two, loudly saying "I'M FINE!!!"        

Part 4, Father happily replies "See!" and Null says "Chisa". Chisa goes on to say with her arms crossed, "Although, Father, I thought *I* would be more important than a cat." Father backpedals and trails off saying "Ah, no, Chisa that's...not...uh...".

Comic part 1 of 4 where a young girl named Chisa meets a cat. She sits next to an angry cat and says, "Kitty...! It's OK..." and the person behind her in green, called Null, thinks "Chisa!" and the man next to him, Father, is excited.
Comic part 2 of 4. Father smiles as he thinks of the cat's cute paw while Null protects Chisa from the cat swiping her. Null glare and the cat runs away with a "MREEOW".

Comic part 3 of 4. Null angrily approaches Father and says "You-!" but is cut off by Father cheerfully saying "See, she's fine!" He thinks to himself, "Besides, that cat can't kill her."

Chisa calls out, "N-Null-ren! Father!" and places herself between them, loudly saying "I'M FINE!!!"

Comic part 4 of 4. Father happily replies "See!" and Null says "Chisa". Chisa goes on to say with her arms crossed, "Although, Father, I thought *I* would be more important than a cat." Father backpedals and trails off saying "Ah, no, Chisa that's...not...uh...".

title: Comforts for Mother
summary:
Mother's research about the State of Things can put her into quite a down mood. Father will try to cheer her up, even for a moment.

This has been sitting around for a loooong while and I finally got around to finishing the last 1.5 panels. It became chibi style cause why not!

imgs.alt: Panel 1 of 4 of a digital comic of a woman leaning against the side of a window, called Mother, with a red tint.
Panel 2 of 4 of a digital comic. An orange patched coat appears on Mother's shoulders and the red tint disappears as she looks down at it.

Page 3 of 4 of a digital comic. Mother looks across to a man with long blond hair, called Father, sitting on a couch across from her. Father is wearing Mother's suit jacket and her tie is chaotically woven into his braided hair. He asks her, "Yes...?"
Page 4 of 4 of a digital comic. Mother smiles sadly, clasping his coat tighter around her. The red tint appears again.

Digital art of a comic of a woman leaning against the side of a window, called Mother, with a red tint. An orange patched coat appears on Mother's shoulders and the red tint disappears as she looks down at it. 

Mother looks across to a man with long blond hair, called Father, sitting on a couch across from her. Father is wearing Mother's suit jacket and her tie is chaotically woven into his braided hair. He asks her, "Yes...?" Mother smiles sadly at him, clapsing his coat tighter around her. The red tint appears again.

title: Why, oh Why...
summary:
Thinking about a certain someone.

Originally Null wasn't going to look this conflicted, just annoyed, but when they ended up that way, figured why not have an alternate embarrassed version.

I imagine when they are frustrated, they run their hand(s) through their hair. Bad negative moments they might tug on it, but generally running a hand through their hair is enough to help gather their thoughts. However, the less the hand(s) move, the more likely they are lost in thought and distracted.
details: (Father may or may not have used this knowledge to antagonize Null whoopies!)

imgs.alt: Waist up art of Null blushing with a hand in their hair with an ivy background.
Full body art of Null blushing with a hand in their hair over an ivy background.

title: Father Sprite: Smug (2024/03)
summary: There was a Trans Day of Visibility hashtag/trend going around for trans artists to post their art (bonus if they were trans OCs!) so I put this together for Father. Nothing new but the background kinda is. The black rectangle ending up by Father's hand was by accident but I love it.

imgs.alt: Art of a man with long dark blonde hair tied back in a low loose pony tail. He's wearing a mixture of clothing types and colours with one gloved raised up. The glove is a reverse of an almost rainbow, which includes grey.

title: Father, using Windows 11 Paint

(Win 11)". The text on the right has the names of each of the brush types written in that brush: "brush, airbrush, calligraphy brush, calligraphy pen, oil brush, crayon, marker, natural pencil, watercolor". title: (Yes hug. No hug. Maybe hug???)
summary: Father wants to give a hug but can’t quite…Embrace it. But it’s ok. Null understands.
details: It’s probably going to be a bit before I can properly explain it, but Null has done a big Thing for Father and Father is so, so, so thankful for it. So much that Father wants to give Null a hug! It’s difficult for Father to full commit to it because of their rocky history, and especially since this Thing seems too good to be true.

imgs.alt: Digital art of Father, a man with long hair and an orange autumn patterned coat, hugging Null, a non-binary person with black and pink tipped hair and a long green coat with an ivy pattern,. Father is hesitant, while Null full embraces it, wrapping their arms around Father's shoulders.

title: Mood

details: It was called "Mood" because this was actually vent art! Mood: cat was me. Wanted to be a cat that could nap on a friendly coat but do not touch.

imgs.alt: Digital art of Father imagining himself holding a kitten with one hand against his chest. But his dreams vanish as the kitten runs away saying "MWAARRR". Tears form in the corner of his eyes.

title: Coat “Tassels”
summary: Father TWEWY OC practice with Pose Maniacs Pose of the Day.
details:
Similar to his coat tassels, Mother's coat can also change shape to be wing/feathery and/or bird like, just got to get inspired 1 hour before bed and spend...more than 1 hour working it.

The writing is based on the Axion pin cause I wanted to practice the writing on those pins.

imgs.alt: Digital art of my OC called Father, a man with his right arm outstretched in front of him and the other bent and raised up next to his head, his left leg bent and half raised to meet his left knee. He's wearing an orange patchy coat with a brown hood and a golden clasp holding the coat together and rainbow gloves. He has frosted blue jeggings, pink leg warmers, rainbow socks with black sneaker sandals. His coat has extremely long and glowing feathers that create rim lighting on his body. He's facing a glowing sigil with very square like writing going from the center of the circle to outwards.

title: Pose practice that turned into Father practice.
summary:
I didn’t have a Noise form for him but his coat makes me think of jellyfish because so I went with that. Or maybe he likes them and has a preference for summoning them.

Because it was pose practice I also wanted to practice less visible parts of his design like his top and the sneaker sandals. And untied hair, cause I wasn’t certain how I wanted the ponytail to work.

Now-a-days I can't see him pulling a pose like this except maybe his early Angel days, still inspired by his former Composer.

imgs.alt: Digital art of a man called Father. He has long blonde half standing half leaning back looking to the left side. He's wearing a green shirt with and orange patchy coat over top, fastened by a gold chain. He's wearing jeggings, pink leg warmers, sneaker sandals and rainbow socks and gloves. His shadow extends left and a black graffiti style jellyfish rises up from it. The background is from left to right is from yellow to orange to red, light to dark.

Digital art of a man called Father. He has long blonde half standing half leaning back looking to the left side. He's wearing a green shirt. He's wearing jeggings, sneaker sandals and rainbow socks and gloves. His shadow extends left and a black graffiti style jellyfish rises up from it.

title: Hanyakoma Hoodie!
summary: Based on the Cat Mario suit. When I originally posted this, it was the calico pattern only because but I wasn’t drawn to the default colours or just black and white, especially with the very strong red and blue lighting. However, when posting this now to other sites (2024 Oct.) it looks fine enough! I'm thinking that the red and blue lighting can help obscure the actual black and white pattern of the hoodie.

imgs.alt: Art of Sanae Hanekoma wearing a black and white cat hoodie, with red bars and blue bars on the sides lighting him up from behind.
Art of Sanae Hanekoma wearing a calico cat hoodie, with red bars and blue bars on the sides lighting him up from behind.

title: It felt like something was missing.
summary: From the Point of Origin by on AO3, part of the Learning Curve series.

imgs.alt:
A comic of Sho talking with Hanekoma in the cafe. “Yeah, whatever, dad…”  Sho freezes once he realizes what he's said.  
Hanekoma is in front of him. “What...did you call me?” Sho berates 
himself but is cut off.
The comic comtinues and Hanekoma hugs Sho tightly and Sho slowly returns the hug, both of them smiling, hugging and happy.

title: Noise Feathers
summary: This was a fun exercise figuring out the shapes and colours of these feathers from the bloom and hands. I didn’t make vectors of these so their quality and compression probably isn’t great but feel free to use/edit them! Credit isn’t necessary for these feathers.

imgs.alt: Digital art of an abstract, white feather from The World Ends With You. It has a sharp and point tip, with one long smooth curve on one side, and then circular cuts into it on the other side.

Digital art of two abstract red and blue feathers from The World Ends With You. The Red feather has got a sharp and pointy tip, with one long straight edge along one side, and then one smooth curved edge the other side. In the widest part of the feather splits it into two.

Digital art of an abstract red feather from The World Ends With You. It's got a sharp and pointy tip, with one long straight edge along one side, and then one smooth curved edge the other side. In the widest part of the feather it splits it into two.

Digital art of an abstract blue feather from The World Ends With You. It's got a sharp and pointy tip, with one long smooth curve on one side, and then slanted and curved cuts into it on the other side.
